title: Enter the ARENA
body:
This is the ARENA. <<transform exit>>
We do a lot of cool research in here.
Let's enter!
Welcome to the ARENA! <<transform enter>>
You're probably wondering what kind of things we do here.
Why not check out some videos? [[Video List|ARENA Videos]]

title: More WiSELab info
body:
WiSELab is a systems research group in the Electrical and Computer Engineering Department at Carnegie Mellon University that focuses on the platforms, protocols and processing techniques that support networked embedded systems.
We are interested in a broad range of topics including: operating system design, wireless networking, sensing technologies, real-time scheduling, time synchronization and localization.
We apply our work to applications such as augmented, virtual and mixed reality, distributed edge computing systems, building energy management, micro-grid management, critical infrastructure monitoring, large-scale environmental sensing and mobile computing.
Check out our website for even more info! <<url https://wise.ece.cmu.edu/>>
What do you want to do next? [[Enter the ARENA]][[Who are you?]]

title: Who are you?
body:
I am an interactive NPC "Non Playable Character" chatbot tour guide.
I am programmed with a visual node-based dialogue tree editor called Yarn. 
Check out my lines! <<image yarn>>
My purpose in life is to talk about the lab and our work. <<image none>>
I can do a lot of cool things! Such as...
Playing sounds, like this jingle: <<sound jingle>>
Playing animations, like this jump: <<animation jump>>
Displaying URL links, like this one about frogs: <<url https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frog>>
Displaying images, like this cat: <<image nyan>>
And also videos, like these fish: <<image none>> <<video rays>>
Thanks for asking! <<video none>>
What do you want to do next? [[Enter the ARENA]][[More WiSELab info]]

title: ARENA Stations
body:
I guess now's a good time to start exploring around if we started already.
Which station shall we go to? [[Lambda]][[Desks]][[Rack]][[Couch]][[Done with stations|ARENA Menu]]

title: Lambda
body:
Check out our Lambda station! <<transform lambda>>
Check this out, we got some really beefy computers here.
These computers are used for photogrammetry processing, machine learning workloads, neural radiance fields and more! 
[[More Stations|ARENA Stations]][[Do something else|ARENA Menu]]

title: Desks
body:
Check out our student desks! <<transform desks>>
We get a lot of really smart people working with us.
Undergrads, masters, PhD, faculty and staff from all over the world hang out here.
[[More Stations|ARENA Stations]][[Do something else|ARENA Menu]]

title: Rack
body:
Here we organize a lot of equipment. <<transform rack>>
One of the most interesting projects is Silverline, the Distributed Runtime for WebAssembly.
It can intelligently and efficiently process complex workloads on a smorgasbord of networked devices with various specifications. 
[[More Stations|ARENA Stations]][[Do something else|ARENA Menu]]

title: About ARENA
body:
ARENA is the beautiful virtual universe where I live!
You can use easily build cross-platform 3D content through a web browser without having to program.
Easily build hybrid AR/VR reality mashups where physical and remote users can interact in real-time.
Content from virtual worlds (VR) can be anchored into the real-world (AR) for use with mobile devices and headsets.
Find nearby content and run programs in the cloud or at the edge on any network-connected device.
The ARENA includes fine-grained access control and the ability to sandbox and isolate your content.
The ARENA networking platform makes it easy to securely connect headless devices like an RPI to your 3D world.
Sharing an ARENA scene is as easy as sending a URL. 
Open on a desktop browser for a VR experience, open on a phone, tablet or headset for VR/AR experience.
Check out "arenaxr.org" today for even more info! <<url https://arenaxr.org/>> [[ARENA Menu]]

title: About WiSELab
body:
WiSELab is a systems research group in the Electrical and Computer Engineering Department at Carnegie Mellon University that focuses on the platforms, protocols and processing techniques that support networked embedded systems.
We are interested in a broad range of topics including: operating system design, wireless networking, sensing technologies, real-time scheduling, time synchronization and localization.
We apply our work to applications such as augmented, virtual and mixed reality, distributed edge computing systems, building energy management, micro-grid management, critical infrastructure monitoring, large-scale environmental sensing and mobile computing.
Check out our website for even more info! <<url https://wise.ece.cmu.edu/>> [[ARENA Menu]]

title: Couch
body:
We got a nice couch, eh? <<transform couch>>
We like to drink coffee with guests to introduce the lab here.
It's a nice place to hang out and chat!
[[More Stations|ARENA Stations]][[Do something else|ARENA Menu]]
